query.prompt:

13 Io non m’accorsi del salire in ella; 14 ma d’esservi entro mi fé assai fede 15 la donna mia ch’i’ vidi far più bella.

16 E come in fiamma favilla si vede, 17 e come in voce voce si discerne, 18 quand’ una è ferma e altra va e riede,
19 vid’ io in essa luce altre lucerne 20 muoversi in giro più e men correnti, 21 al modo, credo, di lor viste interne.
query.result:
16 And as a spark is seen in a flame, 17 and as a voice is discerned in a voice, 18 when one is steady and another goes and returns,
19 I saw in that light other lights 20 moving in a circle, more and less swiftly, 21 according to, I believe, their internal visions.

Please translate literally into English.
22 Di fredda nube non disceser venti, 23 o visibili o no, tanto festini, 24 che non paressero impediti e lenti

Please translate literally into English.

query.result: 31 Then one of them drew nearer to us 32 and began alone: “We are all ready 33 to do your bidding, because you take joy in us.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
34 Noi ci volgiam coi principi celesti 35 d’un giro e d’un girare e d’una sete, 36 ai quali tu del mondo già dicesti:
37 ‘Voi che ’ntendendo il terzo ciel movete’; 38 e sem sì pien d’amor, che, per piacerti, 39 non fia men dolce un poco di quïete».
query.result:
34 We turn with the celestial princes 35 in one gyre and one revolution and one thirst, 36 to whom you once said of the world:
37 ‘You who, in understanding, move the third heaven’; 38 and we are so full of love that, to please you, 39 a little quiet will be no less sweet.”

40 Poscia che li occhi miei si fuoro offerti 41 a la mia donna reverenti, ed essa 42 fatti li avea di sé contenti e certi,

query.result:
40 After my eyes had offered themselves 41 to my lady with reverence, and she 42 had made them content and certain of herself,
43 they turned to the light that had promised 44 itself so much, and “Ah, who are you?” was 45 my voice, marked with great affection.

query.result:

query.result:

73 if evil governance, which always grieves 74 the subject peoples, had not 75 stirred up Palermo to cry out: “Death, death!”

76 And if my brother foresaw this, 77 he would already be fleeing the avaricious poverty of Catalonia, 78 so that it would not harm him;

query.result:
